reviewText:
I waited a little to review this. Got a few hours under my belt of playing so I guess it's a good time.

What makes this game fun?

-Guns. Lots of guns. For lack of better description, it's diablo with guns set in a apocalyptic world.
-Unintentional Humor. The poor translating of the game text has caused for some hilarious quotes from NPCs.
-Community. The number of people playing isn't huge which could be a negative, if it didn't cause for creating a very tight nit like community where a lot of people know each other and know of each other causing the game to feel more friendly and rewarding to log onto. It's kind of like that bar in Cheers. You want to go where everybody knows your name.
-Music. The soundtrack for the game is actually pretty good. I enjoy it a lot.

What makes the game kinda hard/boring/ maybe bad?

-Grindy. While I don't mind, some people might find the game grindy and boring because of it. Once you hit level 50 you kind of run out of quests to do and have to grind dailies and just mobs to get xp to get to the cap level of 60. Kinda rough, but some people actually enjoy this.
-Limitation to your character. Nobody really tells you when you start to watch how you spend your skill points because when you want to respec, you will have to pay real money or start over new character. Well now you know, so maybe it takes one bad thing away.
-Outdated Graphics. Once again, something that doesn't bother me, but might others. A lot of people seem to voice concern of the graphics looking similiar to that of the original Diablo, which can be said they are poor and outdated. However in the time and age of nostalgia, where people are playing 8 bit games on super gaming PCs and not complaining, this seems like a ♥♥♥♥ poor excuse to complain about a game.

Overall. This game is super fun and can get you hooked if you're into this style of games. At the same time, it's not a cup of tea for everyone to share, so give it a try and see if you enjoy the sip.

reviewText:
YET ANOTHER DECENT GAME GETTING BAD REVIEWS BY PEOPLE WHO DO NOT PUT ENOUGH TIME INTO SAID GAME TO WRITE A FACTUAL REVIEW. As short as this game currently is, at least a few hours would show some credibility.

DO NOT LET MY STEAM TIME FOOL YOU. Steam will never reflect my true time in this game, I would much rather continue using the standalone client.

Review Update 10-17-15
As my opinions of the game itself have not changed, I do have some gripes with the current DLC. In short, I do not consider cash shop content to be DLC, & I find it silly to be sold as DLC.

I have been playing this game long before they decided to put it on steam. When the starting point was inside of a tent rather than a medium action heli strike. And currently I hold 3 characters 2 which have already reached current endgame status. <Correction it has been a while since I have played the game and did not realize they raised the cap again. So I have 2 characters sitting at 50. Current end game status is now at 60.

As many have said this game follows in the veins of Diablo (if Diablo had guns). But also I would like to include Shadowgrounds, Alien Breed, Space Siege, Torchlight...I think you are getting the idea...

One of, in the small handful of, true MMOARPG games out. If you have played Dekaron, Dragon's Nest or Defiance, then you are already familiar with how a true MMOARPG should feel. Fast fluid action & reaction, giving you the feeling you are almost chaining skills & attacks. Much like a platformer fighting game it makes you feel you should be watching for a combo meter when attacking.

Some misconceptions already out there.

1. Cash shop items. Only thing that may be desirable...costumes or a vehicle. Honestly neither are desirable. It's a gun game...you will get shot riding on your vehicle anyway as it is not fast enough to outrun bullets and you cannot shoot from your vehicle. Other vehicles are already available in game through a vendor & better PERMANENT costumes can be unlocked with miles" just for playing the game. Even exp bonus/premium status is abolutely unnecessary even for those of us who work that cannot play everyday.

2. No actual gear can be bought in the cash shop. No crafting boost items can be found in the shop.

4. If you run out of ammo...then you really did not look at the game. Or you are a horrible shot. Every character can hold 3 (+1 Single use/mission specific) weapon slots max from the very moment it was created
date: even in the lacking intro tutorial you have this ability.  Each weapon type has it's own ammo pool. Shotguns only use shotgun ammo
hoursPlayed: etc...etc...starting pools are: Single Use Weapon 192 Max/ Pistols 772/ Rifles 970/ Heavy Machine Gun 100/ Shotgun 20/ Sniper 10/ Flamethrower Fuel 100/ Rocket Launcher 8. This is before bonuses on equipment and class specialization.\n\n3. Rocket launchers are not supposed to be accurate like guns
voteText: they are splash damage weapons.\n\n4. Again best things in life
votesHelpful: game...are free. And that is how they have built this game. The best weapons
votesFunny:
& recipes only drop. You will not find any of these in the cash shop. And this is a loot friendly game. Enemies are walking piñatas and drop loot like candy.


Now for some of the good:

Compared to many other MMO's the interface is ridiculously simple.

Quests will carry you all the way out to current endgame status.

Loot
column16: loot...\n\nAll gear uses an RNG method for assigning bonuses to the gear when dropped
column17: much like Borderlands & Defiance. So it gives you true tailorization of your character to fit your playing style.\n\nIf you want to play with a controller
column18: well the option is not there unless you have programming software...but if you do you can play this game like a twin stick shooter.\n\nVery laid back
column19:
sit in your chair and enjoy killing stuff type of game.

Lower tier equipment can be just as good and in some cases better than top tier equipment. This way you do not have to spend a good chunk of your life grinding for top tier items just to keep up with other players.

Account wide storage. There are 2 storage types
column20: personal & account. Both storage types can be decently upgraded with game earned currency. Much like any other F2P game that uses storage to increase it massively will require real cash but
column21: with the RNG bonus stat system and drop rates I doubt you will be storing much. I feel the account wide storage would see more use than personal. But that is just a personal opinion. More so
column22: it's something you would have to see and experience yourself.\n\nTrue character buidling
column23:
each class specialization can be built in different ways to fit how you play vs the old "one build rules all" most games with classes and character building accidentally fall into.

Now for some of the bad:

This is definitely not a "dedicate some time to" type of game. The grinding in quests can get repetitive. It's more heavily gun based than balanced between guns & skills. So if you are good with games of this type you can easily solo areas that were meant to be partied in. This is more of "have fun demolishing enemies with firepower when you want to with friends" type of game.

reviewText:
Basically a MMO version of Torchlight or Diablo that uses guns instead of magic and swords.
Read every dialogue in a russian accent and the broken english won't bother you.

reviewText:
A little mindless, but fun. If you like twin-stick shooters and loot n' scoot games like Diablo you might get some enjoyment out of this one.

If you find humor in reading terrible translations to yourself in stereotypical Russian accents you'll find no shortage of material in the script.

I don't find it a heinous crime that the game can be a little buggy at times. If you're easily amused like I am you'll just laugh it off. Nothing's really game-breaking so far and they're not charging me anything for it. If anything go into it with an open mind and be aware that it lacks polish; you might end up enjoying yourself.

It's a simple time-waster so far with some endearing qualities. I'll update this review as I play if anything sticks out to me.
voteText: 54 of 65 people (83%) found this review helpful 8 people found this review funny

reviewText:
I like the wasd controls, which let me do strafe firing. Thank god it's not mouse only movement like diablo. This game is simple/easy but addicting because of the loot mechanics where any mob can drop legendaries(although rare), unlike some other mmos(i'm looking at you Defiance).  There are only four classes, however the skillpoints you get are few each level so you must be careful on deciding which skilltree on each class you want to choose. It's also a game where you need some reflex if you're going to play some type of class, like sniper.
My biggest gripe is the travel time. In the start, the places you need to go are not too far so it's okay, however as you progress in your quests you would need to go to far away places and there is no quick travel to get there. The only quick travel available is to go back to main town, not the other way around. At level 16 make sure you get the free vechicle in town so you won't bored out of your mind traveling to far places.
Anyhow, It's great so far and I've gotten 3 chars to level 20 (max is way above, i 50+?).
The cash shop provides boost(exp, luck) and custom clothes. I haven't tried pvp yet since I'm a pve player,.. even then this game would last you a long time, it gets a little grindy after lev 30, then again many mmos get grindy at later levels.

edit: nevermind about the quick travel comment, there is indeed a quick travel system in the heliport, don't know how i missed that. thank you commenter

reviewText:
Pros:
+Gun combat is simplistic but fun
+Spawn rates are fast paced and enjoyable
+Enemies ragdoll in amusing ways when they are hit with anything

Cons:
-Feels like a mobile game
-Broken english
-Durability systems on items
-Extremely greedy foreign cash shop that only gives you a chance at desireable items for real money, unless you pay a substantial amount for a single item that most likely will only last 30 days
-Story feels unneccesary and a clunky drawn out addition to otherwise simplistic quests
-You can run out of ammo until you abandon the mission area and resupply right at the start, a nuisance
-Confusing unappealing GUI


Tl;dr it's about as good as you'd expect it to be from the store page.

reviewText:
TL;DR
--------
A fun, casual game for those looking to just relax and mess around. Can provide hours of gameplay since it's a dungeon crawler with varying classes that may use certain weapons. The translation is laughably bad, and the story isn't that really interesting. There's nothing special with the Cash Shop nor is there anything worth buying really, since inventory and bank space can be bought with in-game currency. Fun to play alone, or with friends.

Pros:
--------
- Fun and casual game for those not looking to play something hardcore and just want to kill time / relax on.
- Simple and easy controls / combat / UI
- Casual drop tables, meaning that rare items and up will drop often if you spend some time playing the game, rewarding players for just playing and killing mobs.
- Free mount at lvl 16
- Free gifts just for staying logged in
- Doesn't require a strong computer, so lower-end computer uses can enjoy the game as well
- Instanced missions that can be done with other players and will always give rare rewards at the end depending on how many points the entire team scored.
- Plethora of weapons to use, including chainsaws, rocket launchers and heavy machine guns
- Character customization and wearable armors to make your character look unique to others.
- Can buy more inventory and bank space with in-game currency (CRI).
- Game is not Pay 2 Win
- You can recall back to town, and teleport back to your previous location via the helicopter

Cons:
--------
- Cash shop at the moment doesn't really have anything appealing to buy (Mostly just mounts, costumes, and %magic find potions).
- Hilariously awful translations
- I have no idea what's happening in the story nor do I care
- Game is probably TOO easy for those looking for a challenging dungeon crawler
- Have to buy ammo (but it's cheap and can be found off mobs)

reviewText:
This is not an FPS in any way, shape or form. It's a Twin-Stick-Shooter with classic MMORPG elements and it peeves me that they relate it to an FPS.

The controls are straightforward if a bit janky when activating abilities and because of its isometric perspective it can be a bit hard to land a precise shot when you wish to use weapons that pierce enemies, but other then that the gameplay seems somewhat solid.

I can't say I noticed any P2W aspects during my short foray into this game, only time saving and cosmetic. But I didn't look that closely.

Graphics wise I didn't mess with any settings but on default it looks fine, not spectacular but few isometric games really stand out in this department.

If you enjoy MMOs and classic isometric RPGs then I'd give this game a try since it's free and the download is only around 1,5 gb.

reviewText:
Great game (the idea is):

good:

- Free to play
- Diablo... with guns... on steraroids
- true MMO style (no *invite friends to team up*) its open world
- newbie friendly
- Unable to grind xp (you have to do quests for xp... killing enemies will not give xp... only loot (that i have noticed) can be a bad thing for grind lovers
- The linguistic errors are hillarious (i found an npc who wants pumpkins) she says something like *if you can't get them, you can find me at play* LOL

Bad:

- Diablo... With guns... on steraroids (not everyones cup of tea)
- Linguistic errors CAN be annoying (you have an immportant mission but can't complete it because you can't understand the back to front text) does not happen often
- Graphics: for such a basic made game the graphics ARE good... however... even on my machine (which far surpasses the minimum) i keep getting Graphical lag
- Limited servers/countries (this does not mean only certain countries can play, it just means that you only have servers in Nevada/Kingston and Bikal... if they had an EU server, maybe it would not lag so much?)
-  Limited character creation (not a bad point for me, but there are some people who like to spend 30 mins + tweaking how they look... only takes 30 secs :P)

10/10 would destroy a Wild Camel again! XD

reviewText: This is a peculiar little gem in the rough. It very obviously reeks Diablo-clone, but it manages to keep itself interesting enough to warrant wanting to continue playing it. It's just simple and fun, there isn't a whole lot to think about. The translations are hilariously bad, but you are certainly not playing this game for it's storyline. It's easy to pick up and play in bite-size segments, and it's not pay to win in any way, I haven't spent a single dime and I'm still having a blast. Fully recommended if you want an extremely simple and satisfying game that is reminiscent of DIablo, with guns.

reviewText:
So basically its a Diablo styled MMORPG but well at least its guns and armors instead of fantasy stuff. It is a Free To play MMORPG from the East so yeah its kind of grindy maybe. But the grind sometimes worth it since the weapon and armor is also randomly dropped and sometimes you would get a legendary(purple) traits weapons or armor which can have freaking high stats and bonuses. Well anyways if you like Alien Shooter, or something like that but much easier and with Ammo limitations, well this would be the game maybe.

I had to say its worth a try. At the beginning you'll be shooting everything like a MLG pro since most early mobs takes little shots to be killed lol.

Also I think the PVP would be based on the player's latency sadly. So it'll be pretty bad in PVP i think if the player is from faraway regions and play the game. Oh well just check it for a while and dump it as you wish. Your refund is basically stop playing lol.

reviewText:
This game has a very good concept and with time i think it will be even better.
I started to play this game about a week before steams launch, so i have more hours
in it then what it says above 30+ more.
Unlike what some of these reviews with less then 3 hours in the the game.
the respawn time is acualy kinda fast.
I think that the only time that these people played was shortly after the steam launch when there was so many new players that the server wasnt ready for it and that caused some lag making the respawn time seem longer.
The actual respawn time is rather fast.
Also the rare and legendary drops being to often that is a buff that
new players get, later on they are way harder to get making them much more rewarding when you do get one.
honestly i dont normally play games like this but this game has actually kept my attention for longer than
most AAA releases of late.
Given a little time i think this game will turn into a nice little gem like fine wine i think it just needs a little
time to muture.
I have always wanted to play a game with the concept that this game uses I think its a fun game and recomend
it to both rpg and shooter fans alike.
There is some draw backs such as poor english translation and it is a bit of a grindy game also not a fan of top down shooters but over all the rest of the features make up for it enuff so that i plan to put many more hours into it.

This is only the second review i have ever written on steam and i only do this because i didnt want the game to get
a bad wrap for its first few days on steam problems again before steam launch there was no lag for me.
I trust that the server lag will be taken care of soon the team just needs time to up the strength of the server i have seen it many times

reviewText:
The game reminds me on old games like Cold Zero - The Last Stand and Restricted Area.
This games was nice but with a lot of bugs like Metal Reaper has it too (forgiveable for 2003/2004 but i would say not more for the year 2015).
-bad Hitboxes (use Rocketlauncher and maybe you will understand what i mean)
-dead enemys don´t despawn and so they don´t respawn for a while
-you can walk inside of walls some times and stuck
-rare/super rare/legendary items drops too common
-too many player on the overworld steal questmobs (like in other MMORPG but here player don´t want to group for kill them together)
-aggro from mobs looks very random (you walk between 10 enemys and a random number between 0 and 10 will ignore you without any logic reason)
-gunsounds are broken (sometimes you shot without any sounds)
-game crashed some times random
I asked other people ingame and they validate my arguments.

Good things are that it realy feels like an retro game with the same bugs like in old times.
If this is what you are looking for this game is maybe for you.
If not it´s your free choice to avoid this game.

reviewText:
Bad Engrish aside, this game is really fun.
It's like Diablo with magic/guns/scfi,
great loot drops all the time and from random monsters.

There's different types of guns and different branches (classes) use different special guns,
with a couple regular types (rifle, pistol) every class can use.
There's a support (healer/paladin) that uses shotguns,
panzer (warrior/tank) that uses chainsaw (no ammo req.) and flamethrower,
predator (mage) that uses minigun and rocket launcher,
and sniper (archer) that uses sniper rifle.
Each branch also has different skills/abilities with the usual skill tree and active/passive abilities unlocked by skill points.

There's a durability system, but it's pretty minor cost to repair, and it takes a while to lose it.
The tutorial weapon reward is a durability weapon that doesn't use ammo but durability (since it's like a temp weapon), but any other gun/armor, you can just repair and keep using.

There is a ammo system, but guns have a high max ammo amount,
and you can keep three guns types (with all different ammo types) equipped on your character to easily switch from (with hotkeys), and any other guns in your inventory to equip when you want.
Ammo can last a while if you use different guns, and the return to town skill has a 1 min cooldown, so it's not a big deal.

Armor you find actually changes the character's look, with different colors, too.
(Which is really nice, don't know how many games I liked that you couldn't effect the character's look with the armor you found/equipped).

Shooting/blowing up enemies or killing them with skills, is really satisfying.

So to sum it up, it's a fun hack&slash with some rpg.

reviewText:
I am only recommending this for what the game is, a decent time killer, not how I feel about it since that would be a slight bit biased.

Its a decent ARPG that will likely distract you if youre bored enough for maybe an hour or 2 at a time. I put in almost 15 hours and got to almost level 30. To be safe I will say i got a character to level 25 as a sniper class. You can pretty much solo nearly all the content up until level cap from what im told, which I think is lv50. I havent made it that high so I wouldnt know. This game isnt a Diablo or TQ in terms of quality and quantity, its a basic story, basic, loot system where you see tons of the same gear dropping. THe gear does drop in different grade qualities  which can be extremely rare and unique.

Pro's -

- Decent 2.5D Graphics and model designs
- Interesting concept of character classes and builds
- Upgrading Weapons (Enchanting weapons to higher Stat grades) making them stronger

Con's -

- Cash Shop - Cosmetic and Pay to Win real money cash store - This would normally be an instant game killer for me, but its so small and not as intrusive as most games cash shops are. The suggest using it but you can get by without ever needing it.
- controls are clunky in the style of Twin Stick only working with mouse and keyboard. Would work better with Controlelr support.
- Animations**
- Movement Animations are very clunky and dated, especially with vehilce mounts and mission oriented vehicles.
- Skill & combat animations are not as precise as they could be. Not saying im looking for the accuracy of a AAA game, you will notice if you play that using certain weapons or skills that they tend to miss while landing dead on pretty frequently.

For what the game is worth I grant it a PLAYABLE  6/10
From there take it as you wish.

reviewText: Metal Reaper Online is an action-oriented MMORPG/Shooter set in a post apocalyptic future. You're a member of some rebel group of survivors or something... that's about all I could make out from the terrible Engrish during the cutscenes." (Which are mostly just panning pieces of art.)\n\nThe game itself feels like someone decided to make a Diablo style game with a different setting
date: and guns. The gameplay feels pretty solid
recommended: it is enjoyable running around mowing down big groups of guys and collecting oodles of loot.\nThe downside here is that there's not really much more to the game than that. Everything you do feels about the same as everything else. Quests come in 3 flavors: Kill X number of this
hoursPlayed: go interact with x number of that
voteText: or collect x number of whatevers. Just about every quest in the game is some form of that. On top of that
votesTotal: and will require you to go back to town every so often to refill.\n\nGraphically the game isn't bad. It's not amazing
votesFunny: but the graphics do the job well enough. Things look like you would expect them too
column16: though the enemies could use a little more variety.\n\nLoot is plentiful
column19: however the loot list seems quite shallow. I found myself collecting about 4 or 5 of the same item from a set over the course of an hour. The difference in weaponry is also negligible
column20: outside of the damage output. Basically
column21: just grab the rarest weapon you can find for your class because it will do the most damage. It's a bit like celebrating getting a new Porsche by taking it for a spin
column22: only to discover that everyone else bought themselves a Porsche as well. There's almost no point to any of the weapons except the two highest rarities
column23: because nobody will want them.\n\nSound is about average I would say
column24: with the exception of the music. The music is great!..... the first time or two you hear it. From what I can tell though
column25: there are only 3 songs in the entire game. One for the menu
column27: and one for NOT in town. Which just repeats.... and repeats. As much as you might enjoy it at first
column28:
you'll turn it off soon.

Otherwise the game has a few more things that kind of bothered me.. one is the spawn rate. Dear LORD the spawn rate. You could literally stand in one place at points and complete missions because of the sheer number of mobs that spawn in so quickly. Things will respawn in seconds!

Another MAJOR problem with the game is the Engrish. It's HORRIBLE. I've played games in languages I don't even speak that were more intelligible than this. What's the plot? The storyline? I don't know
column29: because I couldn't make sense of the stuff on the screen. Google translate could probably do a better job here if not at least as good.\n\nLastly
column30: the game is EASY. I mean
column31: ludicrously easy. I was able to run through group mission areas that I was underleveled for
column33: without so much as losing a single HP. It's almost to the point where it's a casual game
column35:
about the only way you're going to die is if you go AFK in the middle of a pack of mobs.

TLDR
All in all

reviewText:
If you're a fan of Diablo-esque loot-'em-up RPGs and enjoy grinding to get your gear, give this a whirl.

It's simple, straightforward and fun.

So far, I haven't encountered anything broken, aside from the Engrish both in dialog and quest descriptions.

One of my pet peeves, is that you can't run over enemy NPCs with your vehicle but it's nothing major.
What drew me to the game is that it's a hack-and-slash loot-'em-up RPG(A genre I have lots of fun with) using a modern or rather apocalyptic theme.
Seeing as there's not that many similar games, I decided to give it a try and to my surprise it's a solid game.

All in all, the game's above average, though not by too far.

reviewText:
PROS:

WoW-style servers where everyone shares one world with different maps for each area.
Diablo-style graphics, loot, and camera angles.
Similar playstyle as the arcade zombies from call of duty.

The loot system is GREAT. 5 stars on this front. It's if Diablo 2 met Diablo 3 and they had a baby: if you are in a party (which goes up to 3 players unless your in a special mission), then there is a shared loot system. If you are not in a party, other players in your server can see your drops - but they cant pick them up. Nothing is bound on pickup other than items from quests ONLY. Most rare/super rare/legendary/set items are bind on equip, which means... you guessed it...

There is an Auction House. Lovin' it. If you get tired of grinding, you can always try to take control of the AH. Theres is a decent yet small enough community where the prices fluctuate a lot but things still sell easy enough so long as you are smart about it. Many times if you need that 1 last set piece, it wont be there.., BUT.... theres the same chance it will be there. It's a 50/50 chance really. Yet something of some sort of help will always be available until you reach high end levels, so long as you've got the CRI (which is the free ingame currency). If you like playing the AH like me, you can easily become rich fast here. I'm not - I liquidate everything cuz I'm too impatient - but someday perhaps ^_^.

Rushing characters is not possible. At all. Two thumbs up. You MUST play through the game. ... I like it.

Types of customizable gears include armors/legs/boots/helmets/gloves/plate which is like a shield/neck/rings/weapons/etc. Types of weapons are pistols/shotguns/machine guns/flamethrowers/rocket launchers/snipers/chainsaws/rifles. Any of these can be crafted, but it's not viable until later on in the game.) Additionally, you can get gear called avatar from certain quests or from the coin shop (real money shop) that will alter your ingame appearance and may have some large boosts for dmg, def, move speed, etc. This is a separate tab and is worn over" your regular gear. Enjoy! =)

You build and level up a character of one of 4 classes. Not difficult to grasp. Each class has its skill tree specific to it
date:
You can dodge (ninja-roll) which is surprisingly effective.

CONS:
Not much information for this game is available on the web.
The game is a little choppy/buggy - not too bad for me yet
recommended:
but it's happened to others from what I've heard.
Graphics could be better - but this could also be seen as a PRO because you don't need a super video card or processor to run it.
Monotonous grinding aspect to the questline.
Bad translations - which can be funny at times
hoursPlayed: but can also be confusing at times. "If you don't give me delicious
voteText: I'll be at play." ...... what?\nGame gets progressively more difficult
helpfulPercent: inspiring it's users to pay money for temporary buffs from the coin shop - however this isnt entirely necessary. Could be seen as a PRO because it inspires you to try harder aswell and get more skillful."
